citations.narrative:
In October 2022, the licensee transported a spider monkey (less than 6-months-old) to a sale located out of state, where
the animal was sold. The licensee did not get a health certificate for this monkey. A health certificate from a licensed
veterinarian within 10 days of transporting a nonhuman primate in commerce is required to ensure the animal appears
free of any infectious disease or physical abnormality which would endanger the animal during transport. Correct by
obtaining health certificates for nonhuman primates from a licensed veterinarian no more than 10 days prior to
transporting the animals in commerce. Correct from this day forward (February 28th, 2023).
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the licensee.
End Section

narrative:
2.78(a) 
   
Health certification and identification. 
In October 2022, the licensee transported a spider monkey (less than 6-months-old) to a sale located out of state, where 
the animal was sold. The licensee did not get a health certificate for this monkey. A health certificate from a licensed 
veterinarian within 10 days of transporting a nonhuman primate in commerce is required to ensure the animal appears 
free of any infectious disease or physical abnormality which would endanger the animal during transport. Correct by 
obtaining health certificates for nonhuman primates from a licensed veterinarian no more than 10 days prior to 
transporting the animals in commerce. Correct from this day forward (February 28th, 2023). 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the licensee. 
 
End Section
